node.display_long_description:
"Vanishing Grace" is a narrative puzzle game set in a near-future where a solar storm has changed life on Earth.

You play as Joel, a civil servant who has a quiet life until one day he discovers that Grace, his childhood friend, has disappeared.
Her craft has reached the Citadel unmanned. It's at this point that Joel decides to leave everything behind to find her.
Pilot Grace's craft and travel around desolate wastelands while you discover the story behind her mysterious disappearance.

•Face the challenge of piloting Grace's craft and ascertaining her whereabouts.
•Use a futuristic boomerang to collect the craft’s energy from stones that float in the environment.
•Repair the craft through fun puzzles.
•Discover a deep story about the sacrifices we have to make to find our place in the world.

nodes.title: Update 1.02 is now available!
nodes.body_text:
Hello everyone!! First of all, we wanted to thank you for your support!

We've heard all your feedback, and we take note of it. So we release our first update, which includes improvements and some bug fixes.

1.02 PATCH NOTES

General updates

- We added Smooth Turn
- We added more options to the menu before entering the game
- We added a circle on the floor to let the players know if they leave the center of the play area in joystick mode
- We added an SFX that allows the players to know when they can't enter the craft
- We added a sign, so the Gas Station puzzle is easier to understand

Bug fixes

- Fixed a bug that may prevent the Solar Sail crank from moving
- Fixed a bug that may prevent some players from entering the craft in the first chapter
- Fixed a bug that may prevent the cassette tapes from reproducing properly
- Fixed a bug that may change the players' height

node.reviewDescription:
I am a big fan of story-driven games with puzzle elements, and I had hoped this game would be a strong contender. Unfortunately, this game was only so-so for me. Main issues were bugs (clipping, crashing), lack of real decisionmaking, and length (very short). 

It was so short in fact, I would have qualified for a return if I hadn’t crashed multiple times and had to replay several chapters from scratch. And given you can’t skip narration, if you get sent back to the beginning, you are sitting there waiting to hear the same narration all over again, go through the same wrote motions again, and generally waste time trying to get back to where you left off.

Movement was fine except there were issues with clipping into objects if you moved too close, and when you tried to back up, you might end up across the room again. Sometimes just to open a drawer I would need to click five or six times, getting too close, too far, just past, in the table, oriented wrong, okay got it. 

Another reviewer mentioned that some of the stops along the way seemed like fun opportunities to explore, but they ended up being little to nothing to do. That was so right. Without spoilers, I can say that your chances to explore are limited, frustratingly tantalizing showing places you can’t go into, and your task when there is a simple “take this object, put it down over there.” Rinse, repeat.

The story was fine, voice acting above average, the ending a little lackluster. Animation was good, not great. Concept held so much potential Not worth $20 IMO, I’d wait until there is a great sale or the price comes own. If this were closer to a $5-$10 game I might have rated it higher, but for $20, the value just isn’t there.

developerResponse.body:
Thanks for the honest review! We appreciate that you played it. If you want to give us more info about those crashes, feel free to reach us. They shouldn't happen. 

In any case, thanks again, and have a great day!!
